questions.stem: Which client finding requires immediate nursing intervention?
Which findings indicate the client is deteriorating? (Select all that apply)
What is the nurse’s first action based on the current assessment?
Which assessment findings require immediate follow-up by the nurse? (Select all that apply)
Which change in the client’s condition is most concerning?
Which provider orders should the nurse question? (Select all that apply)
choices: Administer potassium to a client with hyperkalemia
Give beta-blocker to a hypotensive client

questions.stem: Which assessment data indicate the client is unstable?
Which findings suggest the client’s condition is improving? (Select all that apply)
Which finding places the client at greatest risk for harm?
Which client statements indicate effective understanding of teaching? (Select all that apply)
choices: I will complete the full course of antibiotics
I will stop my medication when I feel better
I will monitor my blood glucose daily
I will call my provider if symptoms worsen
